content.text:
# List of Singaporean submissions for the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film

Singapore has submitted films for the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film}} since 2005, although they submitted a film while still being a British colony in 1959. The award, first established at the 28th Academy Awards ceremony, is handed out annually by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences (AMPAS) to a feature-length motion picture produced outside the United States that contains primarily non-English dialogue. The academy selection committee reviews all the submitted films, and secret ballot voting is used to determine the five nominees.
As of 2025, Singapore has submitted nineteen films, but none of them were nominated.
Submissions
's films had been submitted for the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film. Three were not nominated, while his first submission, Be With Me, was disqualified.]]
The director whose films have been submitted the most is Eric Khoo, four times; one was disqualified for being more than 50% in English. Khoo is followed closely by Anthony Chen, who directed three submissions: Ilo Ilo (2013), Wet Season (2018) and The Breaking Ice (2023).
Two submissions have been musical films: the 1959 musical-drama The Kingdom and the Beauty, as well as the 2007 881.
